meanings.definition: The state of being deserted or uninhabited.
meanings.sent1: The desolateness of the old house gave it a spooky feel.
meanings.sent2: The desolateness of the island made it a perfect place for a quiet retreat.
meanings.sent3: The desolateness of the playground on a rainy day made the children sad.
meanings.sent4: The desolateness of the desert stretched out endlessly under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The desolateness of the abandoned factory echoed with eerie silence.

meanings.definition: A feeling of loneliness or sadness.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the desolateness that lingered after her friend moved away.
meanings.sent2: The desolateness in his eyes revealed the pain he was trying to hide.
meanings.sent3: The desolateness of losing the game was quickly replaced by determination to win next time.
meanings.sent4: The desolateness of the empty room matched her somber mood perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The desolateness of the rainy day mirrored her melancholy heart.

meanings.definition: The quality of being bleak or barren.
meanings.sent1: The desolateness of the landscape was broken only by a few leafless trees.
meanings.sent2: The desolateness of the winter scene made her long for the warmth of spring.
meanings.sent3: The desolateness of the fridge shocked him when he realized he had no food left.
meanings.sent4: The desolateness of the mountain peak left him in awe of nature's power.
meanings.sent5: The desolateness of the abandoned town was a stark reminder of its former glory.
